content:
EXISTING STRUCTURES
──────────────────────
### Stone Furnace Facility at position (0.0, 0.0)
Consists of:
- Stone Furnace (position: 0.0, 0.0) – Smelts iron ore into iron plates.
- Iron Chest (position: 1.5, 0.5) – Stores produced iron plates.

### Iron Ore Mining Setup at position (-16.0, -51.0)
Consists of:
- Burner Mining Drill (position: -16.0, -51.0) – Extracts iron ore.
- Burner Inserter (position: -14.5, -49.5) – Transfers ore from the belt.
- Transport Belt (position: -15.5, -49.5) – Delivers extracted ore.
- Iron Chest (position: -13.5, -49.5) – Stores extracted ore.
- Intermediate Transport Belt (position: -15.5, -47.5) – Feeds ore to a remote branch.
- Burner Inserter (position: -14.5, -47.5) – Transfers ore on the intermediate belt.
- Remote Output Chest (position: -13.5, -47.5) – Receives ore from the remote inserter.

### Copper Furnace at position (-27.0, -60.0)
Consists of:
- Stone Furnace (position: -27.0, -60.0) – Smelts copper ore into copper plates.

### Lab Power Integration System at position (0.5, 2.5)
Consists of:
- Lab (position: 0.5, 2.5) – Processes science packs.
- Offshore Pump (position: -7.5, 25.5) – Draws water from the resource at (-9.0, 25.0).
- Boiler (position: 2.0, 17.5) – Converts water into steam; fuel supplied (10 coal) but remains unconnected.
- Steam Engine (position: 5.5, 5.5) – Intended for power generation; still not properly connected.
- Electricity Network comprising:
  • Small Electric Pole (position: 2.5, 2.5)
  • Small Electric Pole (position: 3.5, 2.5) – Added to support power delivery.
  • Small Electric Pole (position: 4.5, 3.5)
  • Small Electric Pole (position: 6.5, 0.5) – Newly placed to extend the network.

### Pipe Production Facility at position (3.5, 0.5)
Consists of:
- Assembling Machine (position: 3.5, 0.5) – Configured to craft Pipes; production is stalled due to power issues and a missing iron-plate requirement.
- Iron Chest (position: 1.5, 0.5) – Stores crafted Pipes.
- Connected to the shared Electricity Network (via the newly added poles).

ERROR TIPS
──────────────────────
• Crafting and Sub-ingredient Verification  
  - Ensure all required raw materials and intermediate sub-ingredients are available in sufficient quantities before initiating any craft.

• Entity Placement and API Usage  
  - Verify target tiles are unoccupied and that positional references are correct when placing entities.

• Connection and Variable Reference Validation  
  - Confirm that all necessary entities have been properly defined and are available prior to establishing connections.

• Research Prerequisite Confirmation  
  - Complete all required technology research (e.g., unlocking Solar Energy by fulfilling prerequisites such as Optics) before attempting to craft advanced items like Solar Panels.

• Pipe Connection and Inventory Management  
  - Check that the pipe inventory meets the connection requirements when linking fluid systems, ensuring enough Pipes are available for connections between the Offshore Pump, Boiler, and Steam Engine.

• Fluid Connection Accuracy  
  - Route water through an operational Boiler to convert it to steam before attempting connection to the Steam Engine.

• General Best Practices  
  - Regularly monitor inventory status and verify connection configurations to avoid repetitive errors.

• Electrical Network Expansion and Power Supply  
  - Place additional electric poles with appropriate spacing and avoid conflicts with existing structures (e.g., Iron Chest placements).
  - Verify that newly added poles integrate correctly into the shared Electricity Network so that production facilities (like the Assembling Machine) reliably receive power.

• Solar Panel Crafting and Placement  
  - Unlock and complete the necessary research for Solar Energy before attempting to craft, place, or connect Solar Panels, and ensure that the corresponding items are present in the inventory.

• Crafting Reference and Research Flow  
  - Use correct naming and attribute references in crafting API calls to prevent name errors and ensure research-related functions operate as expected.
